page.title: 13Crops in Rhenigidale cont.
page.content: {Hay racks}In a few days, when the hay is dry it is taken off and stored away either in a shed or made into haystacks. The process is then repeated until all the grass has been harvested. The hay is used throughout the winter to feed the cow and sheep. {Vegetables}for consumption in the home are also grown in lazy beds. These include lettuces, cabbages, onions, carrots, turnips, beetroot and parsnips. {Corn}Again the seed is sown in lazy beds. The soil is turned over by spade and then the seed and fertiliser is spread by hand and the ground raked. In the Autumn the corn is cut with a scythe and then tied into sheaves and 6 or 7 of these sheaves are then stacked together. After a few days of drying all the sheaves are gathered into large cornstacks.
